problem.text: Identifiers in specification namespace must be unique.
problem.description: 4.1 (N1) An AADL specification has one global namespace. The package and property set identifiers reside in this space and must be unique.

problem.text: A defining package name must be unique in the global namespace.
problem.description: 4.2 (N1) A defining package name consists of a sequence of one or more package identifiers separated by a double colon (“::”). A defining package name must be unique in the global namespace.

problem.text: The package name in a import_declaration must exist in the global name space.
problem.description: 4.2 (N7) The package name in a import_declaration must exist in the global name space.

problem.text: The package name referenced in an alias_declaration must exist in the global namespace.
problem.description: 4.2 (N11) The package name referenced in an alias_declaration must exist in the global namespace and must be listed in the import_declaration.

problem.text: The package name referenced in an alias_declaration must be listed in the import_declaration.
problem.description: 4.2 (N11) The package name referenced in an alias_declaration must exist in the global namespace and must be listed in the import_declaration.

problem.text: Classifier referenced if not found in public package section.
problem.description: 4.2 (N12) The classifier referenced by the alias_declaration must exist in the name space of the public section of the package being referenced by the alias_declaration.

problem.text: Wrong reference structure, no package is referenced
problem.description: 4.2 (N12) The classifier referenced by the alias_declaration must exist in the name space of the public section of the package being referenced by the alias_declaration.

problem.text: The component category does not match the category of referenced component type.
problem.description: 4.2 (L4) The component category in an alias declaration must match the category of the referenced component type.

problem.text: Conflict of alias name of the package with imported package.
problem.description: 4.2 (L4) The defining identifier of an alias_declaration must be unique in the namespace of the package containing the alias_declaration. If an alias_declaration defines an alias for a package then the alias name must not conflict with any package name listed in an import_declaration or that of the package containing the alias_declaration.

problem.text: Conflict of alias name of the package with package name where it is defined.
problem.description: 4.2 (L4) The defining identifier of an alias_declaration must be unique in the namespace of the package containing the alias_declaration. If an alias_declaration defines an alias for a package then the alias name must not conflict with any package name listed in an import_declaration or that of the package containing the alias_declaration.

problem.text: The defining identifier of an alias_declaration is not unique in package namespace.
problem.description: 4.2 (L4) The defining identifier of an alias_declaration must be unique in the namespace of the package containing the alias_declaration. If an alias_declaration defines an alias for a package then the alias name must not conflict with any package name listed in an import_declaration or that of the package containing the alias_declaration.

problem.text: A data type declaration contains not allowed features.
problem.description: 5.1 (L1) A data type declaration can contain provides subprogram access declarations as well as property associations.

problem.text: A data type declaration must not contain modes subclause.
problem.description: 5.1 (L2) A data type declaration must not contain a flow specification or modes subclause.

problem.text: A data type declaration must not contain flow specification.
problem.description: 5.1 (L2) A data type declaration must not contain a flow specification or modes subclause.
